ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Camp from hell...
ygData.msgSnippet: At least a yk is worth the camp time...with my rogue I camped the warden in upper guk to get a trollhide belt, and after 12 hours I still hadn t gotten it.
ygData.messageBody:
At least a yk is worth the camp time...with my rogue I camped the warden in upper guk to get a trollhide belt, and after 12 hours I still hadn't gotten it. Thats 12 hours of 0 exp, 0 loot, and one immense headache.
----- Original Message -----
From: Mike Roach
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Sent: Monday, March 06, 2000 9:29 AM
Subject: [eqbards] Camp from hell...


From: Mike Roach <Mike.Roach@...>

How in the world to people obtain Ykeshas these days? I heard they used to
drop a lot more often but this is absurd. Yesterday I logged on at 11am CST
in lguk and joined a Savant group, sent a tell to the list holder of the
Lord group and started killing frogs. I was finally called for my turn in
the Lord group at 6pm CST, 7 hours later. Shortly after I arrived one of
the people ahead of me on the list fell asleep after an 18 hour camp and the
guy after him got a Yak.

The group changed a couple times in the next hour so by 8pm I was on the top
of the list for a Yak, 2 hours after joining the group. We then camped the
room and I finally gave up with no Yak (5 SSB's) at 2:30am, 7 and a half
hours and no Yak. By the time I left I was the only original group member
left.

Meanwhile people continue to berate me for wielding a staff of writhing at
42nd level. What's a bard to do, has it always been this tough of a camp?
This is totally absurd.

-Faras
